titleStmt.title: H. S. Powell et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5578

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To His excellency the Honerabe Thomas E Bramlet govenor of the Commonwealth of Ky we the undersigned citizens of Jackson county would Most Respectfully Represent to your honer that George Hellard was Indited in our circuit court in the year 1861 charge with sheap stealing, and the said hellard has not yet Been tride as he has Been in the Federal Army and has B^e^en honerably discharge and is now At home with his family. And the prosecutor is dead, and there is one witness that May prove Enough to find him guilty of petit larceny and as It Might Might turn out that he would have to Be whipt,, & now we will say to you that Mr Hellard has as Respectful a wife as any Man in our county and A Large family of Interresting children & Many of us Being his fellow solgers in camp and of confidence in hellard for the futeur do ask you to pardon him if you concur with your umble Petitioners

J. M. Wood ck of the Jackson Cir & Co Courts
Henry Faubers
Wm J. Webb
William Raders J. C.
Frank Faubers
R. M. Green J. J. C
John S Hamilton
Jobe Morris D. S. J. C.
John Farmer Masts J. C.
C S Master J. C.
John Penington x Capt 47th Ky vol
V U Morniss J. S J C
Geo Baker Dept of
H S Powell P. J. C. C.
Ambrose Powell J S G C
John Stephens
A. Martin
W. H. Moody
A. P. Settles
H. O. Darnell
Wm. R. Coor
J C H Assessor
L C Gobbern
Elisha Hardon
J R. Isaacs

Jackson Circuit Cour
vs
George Hellard
Petition
Refused
